etymology.description: Simplified from 賓; semantic: 宀 (“roof; dwelling”) + phonetic: 兵 (bīng).
etymology.interpretation: Roof 宀 evokes a house or hosting space, pointing to hospitality and visitors. 兵 contributes the sound (bīn ≈ bīng), while the meaning remains “guest/visitor.”
etymology.simplification: Replaced the complex lower component of 賓 with 兵 to reduce strokes and regularize it as a phono-semantic form; officially adopted in 1956.

examples.chinese: 今天我们在家里招待宾客(今天我們在家裡招待賓客)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān wǒmen zài jiālǐ zhāodài bīnkè.
examples.english: Today we entertained guests at home.

examples.chinese: 会议开始前，主持人欢迎各位来宾(會議開始前，主持人歡迎各位來賓)。
examples.pinyin: Huìyì kāishǐ qián, zhǔchírén huānyíng gèwèi láibīn.
examples.english: Before the meeting began, the host welcomed all the guests.

examples.chinese: 这家宾馆靠近火车站(這家賓館靠近火車站)。
examples.english: This hotel is close to the train station.
